articles.description: Pres. Trump is headed for an impeachment trial in the Senate overseen by a judge he once called an “absolute disaster,” Chief Justice John Roberts.  MSNBC Chief Legal Correspondent Ari Melber reports on Roberts’ work as a lawyer, his testimony as a judicial n…

articles.description: The Academy Award nominiations are out. And three films from the Meet The Press Film Festival are nominated for Best Documentary - Short Subject.

articles.content:

articles.title: Looking into the close race for Iowa

articles.title: Booker suspends campaign: How could it affect the race?
articles.description: Senator Cory Booker (D-NJ) is ending his presidential campaign, and he leaves a democratic field with few candidates of color. MSNBC’s Ali Velshi talks with Washington Post opinion writer Jennifer Rubin and the president of Color of Change, Rashad Robinson, a…

articles.title: Skepticism in the Middle East over Soleimani strike
articles.description: New York Times foreign correspondent Rukmini Callimachi talks with Ali Velshi about how people in the Middle East view the U.S. strike that took out Iranian general Qassem Soleimani, and what it means for this volatile region of the world.

articles.title: Buttigieg scores Iowa endorsement three weeks ahead of caucus
articles.description: Congressman Dave Loebsack (D-IA) endorsed then-Senator Barack Obama in 2007. He joins Ali Velshi to share why he thinks former South Bend Mayor, Pete Buttigieg, has what it takes to beat President Trump this November.

articles.title: Frontline investigates 'America’s Great Divide: From Obama to Trump'
articles.description: PBS’s new two-part documentary discusses America’s polarized politics and the moments that worsened the division within our nation. Film director Michael Kirk joins Ali Velshi to discuss some of his top takeaways after working on the film, and the factors tha…
